content: Extend the scheduling model with a global constraint on total shift duration. Each shift has a specified duration, and the sum of the durations of all selected shifts must not exceed a global limit H. All tasks must still be covered exactly once, and the objective remains minimizing the number of selected shifts.
value_info: `n_tasks`: Total number of tasks to cover, given as an integer.
`shifts`: A list where shifts[i] is the list of task indices covered by shift i.
`shift_durations`: A list of integers where shift_durations[i] is the duration of shift i.
`H`: A global integer limit representing the maximum total duration allowed across all selected shifts.

var1.descr: `x`: A binary list of length n_shifts. `x[i] = 1` means shift i is selected; `x[i] = 0` means it is not selected.
